abstract: Committee to Protect Journalists reports at least 69 journalists were killed in line of duty in 2015, with Islamic militant groups like Al Qaeda NS Islamic State responsible for 40 percent of deaths; says Syria and France were two deadliest countries.
lead_paragraph: An annual tally by the Committee to Protect Journalists shows that at least 69 were killed in the line of duty, and that Islamic militants were responsible for 40 percent of the deaths.

headline.main: Syria and France Said to Be Deadliest for Journalists in 2015
headline.print_headline: Syria and France Were Deadliest for Journalists in 2015, Report Says

snippet: An annual tally by the Committee to Protect Journalists shows that at least 69 were killed in the line of duty, and that Islamic militants were responsible for 40 percent of the deaths.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
